Job Title: Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) - RPA Seni
Description:
Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET)- RPA Specialist


Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in RPA technology?

A Software DevelopmentEngineerin Testwho wants to work in a collaborativeenvironment while providing best class services to our clients? As an SDET - RPA Specialist you will have the ability to share new ideas and collaborate on projects as a consultant without the extensive demands of travel.Consider an opportunity with our US Delivery Center - we are breaking the mold of a typical Delivery Center.

Our US Delivery Centers have been growing since 2014 with significant, continued growth on the horizon. Interested? Read more about our opportunity below ...

Work you'll do/Responsibilities

ImplementRPA Automation solutions to test automation functions using tools such asBlue Prism or UiPath
RecommendRPA processes and developsolutions to assist QA/Test Engineers in test planning, execution, and reporting.
Drive deployment of RPA components within QA: bots, robots, development tools in the QS space
Work with QA/Testing teams to determine identify gaps and constraints associated with testing requirements and business processes and provide solutions to resolve the issues
Drive best practices in QA Engineering specifically in Intelligent Robotics and Automation.
Develop strategies and scenarios for review with both project and client teams to ensure alignmentwith project delivery documentation

The Team

Our Systems Engineering team delivers large-scale software applications and integrated systems, and assists clients with architecture design, assessment and optimization, and definition. We develop service-oriented architecture (SOA) and other integration solutions to enable information sharing and management between business partners and disparate processes and systems, and we deliver technology enablement to support CIO services transformation.

SystemsEngineeringprofessionals focus on key client issues that impact the core business by maximizing operational value, driving down the cost of quality, and enhancing technology innovation. Our teams deliver a wide range of services, including application architecture design and optimization, application modernization, business process management and solution integration, custom application design and development, and large-scale technology delivery program efforts.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience
Experience withRPAtools such as Blue Prism, and/or UiPath
Experience in comprehensive software testing techniques and methodologies
Experience with scripting languages such as C#, Java Script, or Visual Basic
Solid understanding of programming concepts and knowledge ofobject oriented development fundamentals
Ability to multi-task wile supporting multiple priorities/multiple deliverables
Strong verbal and written communication skills, especially when communicating technical topics to business stakeholders
Legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future
Must be able to live, commute, or relocate to the Lake Mary, FL or Gilbert, AZ area.
Travel up to 20%

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in test automation solutions such asCucumber or Selenium (or other equivalent industry standard solutions)

How you'll grow
At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there's always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-joblearning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

Benefits
At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits.

Deloitte's culture
Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can helpthem to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives.

Corporate citizenship
Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. .

Recruiter tips
We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you're applying to.

SDET QA Engineer
Long-term Contract
Remote
IMMEDIATE new job opening for an SDET Quality Assurance Engineer to join our team and work remotely for our global client. The right candidate is passionate about testing, especially automated testing and can talk about the successes they have achieved through automation. Candidate is responsible for developing, designing and implementing automated and manual testing to support e-commerce initiatives across our online properties. This individual will be a pivotal member of an Agile Scrum team working closely with product owners, front-end developers and back-end developers to drive a successful testing strategy. This individual should be passionate about testing and delivering quality via test automation.
Responsibilities:
o Own and support testing as a member of an agile software development team
o Review story requirements and interpret requirements to develop comprehensive testing strategies
o Critical thinking to translate complex application flows to test cases
o Design, develop and execute automated front end testing leveraging Java with WebDriver / TestNG.
o Design, develop and execute automated services testing leveraging Groovy scripting with JMeter / SoapUI /API.
o Contribute to Enterprise Test Automation Frameworks when needed
o Share in the ownership of consistently delivering highly functional and stable code.
o Provide accurate estimates for test strategy, design and execution work
o Apply an understanding of distributed systems to configure test environments and execute test plans.
o Document, communicate and escalate test results and defects
o Utilize Test Management tool to maintaining automated and manual test flows.
o Utilize Jenkins / Maven / Git / Stash for continuous integration and version control of automation artifacts.
o As needed, coordinate activities between US and remote testing teams.
o Be an advocate for new/expanded automation technologies and methodologies.
o Innovation is strongly encouraged and opportunities exist for leveraging existing automated testing capabilities to support non-traditional testing needs
o Be an advocate of technical and business domain knowledge sharing.
o Occasional off-hours support may be required.
Requirements:
o 5+ years of SDET experience (must have ReadyAPI)
o 4 years of API focused Automation experience required
o Development experience with Java or Python required
o At least 5 years of automation experience in the U.S. required
o 5-8 years of experience in development using J2EE/Groovy Shell and DB SQL in Linux and Windows platforms.
o Hands-on engineer with ability to code in various programming languages (preferably in Java), JavaScript, SQL etc. to automate tests for the full solution stack (UI, App Layer, REST API, Web Service).
o Demonstrated experience in test automation development, using frameworks and tools like Junit, TestNG, Appium, Cucumber, Postman as well as REST/JSON APIs.
o Verifiable experience in building and deploying CI systems such Jenkins, Bamboo. Hands-on experience building CI automation pipelines using Jenkins, Docker.
o Data driven, with strong problem-solving skills with analytical capabilities to be able to support theories/solutions using underlying data.
o Knowledge of Cloud based Web Applications Architecture.
o Knowledge of deployment technologies with emphasis on AWS Cloud.
o Knowledge of using the Selenium Grid for parallel execution of Test Cases in Multiple Browsers.
o Good understanding of the Extent Reports2.0, Eclipse IDE and Java for developing the Automation Scripts.
o Experience in developing Feature Files using Gherkins language for the BDD.
o Good Understanding of the CI and CD.
o Experience with the Postman, ReadyAPI with Groovy scripting to Test the APIs.
o Must have worked on the SQL queries and other Database scripts.
o Hands On knowledge of using the No-SQL databases like Couchbase etc.
o Knowledge of using the JMeter or BlazeMeter for the performance testing of the APIs.
o Thorough understanding of concurrency, threading, algorithms, and data structures.
o Good Front End UI experience on HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
o Create and execute SQL queries and validate databases using an automation tool.
o Bachelors or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related Engineering field.
o Experience in BDD/TDD, Agile/SCRUM & DevOps team, developed and maintained test sets for the Hospitality relation business.
o 5-8 years of experience in Micro services, Web services testing using SOAP and REST based service & XML, JSON. Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins and GIT and other relevant tools.
o Automation Frameworks and Automating Test Cases using Commercial and Open source tools.
o A minimum of 5-8 years of experience with script and non-script based Functional tools such as Eclipse/IDE, Extent Reports, TestNG, Selenium, Test Complete, and QTP.
o A minimum of 5-8 years of experience in creating frameworks that utilize and interact with DevOps tools such as Couchbase, JIRA, Stash, Bamboo, Confluence, Ready API - Soap UI Pro, Ready API - ServiceV, Git, Jenkins.

Job Title: Senior Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET)
Description:
Senior Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET)
Listeners On Call
Feel heard, and make a difference! Listeners On Call is committed to connecting anyone, anywhere, anytime with someone who has a related personal experience and is ready to listen. We are proud to offer App-based on-call empathy, privacy and support for people who need to feel heard. Our company is based in Dallas, Texas and employs high-quality people across the United States. With our flexible, remote work policy, we empower our team to contribute to our mission while maintaining the quality of life they desire.
The Team
Listeners On Call is an early startup, and we’re just beginning to expand the development team, so you will be on the ground floor of this exciting opportunity, laying the foundation for a highly-performing engineering team. Surrounding us is a host of caring, empathetic individuals who use their diverse talents and enthusiasm to build and maintain customer and partner relationships, drive customer engagement and retention, powered by genuine care for our customer’s needs and how to provide an exceptional user experience.
Job Description
As an SDET at Listeners On Call, you will be responsible for ensuring a high degree of quality and a phenomenal customer experience throughout our software development lifecycle. You will be working closely with Product, Design, Support, and Development, ensuring we consider quality from initial design through product delivery. You will be performing manual verification, writing and executing test case scenarios, and automating the testing of our mobile app, web, and API systems.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Understanding the flow of code and how it interacts with different components.
Understanding project documents, customer demands, and product objectives to create and execute test cases.
Setting up, maintaining, and performing test automation frameworks on multiple application platforms, including mobile, web and API infrastructure, and building test scenarios and acceptance tests.
Designing, organizing and leading group test scenarios and multi-user quality validation.
Investigating customer problems referred to you by the technical support team, testing bugs, and creating and managing bug reports.
Coordinating on product design, and offering input on the testability of functional elements and product designs.
Managing the final quality on production releases.
Requirements
A Bachelor's degree or requisite experience in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field.
5+ years of industry experience, with 3+ years writing automated tests.
Excellent architecture and programming skills.
Experience with Python, Javascript & SQL preferred.
Experience testing mobile applications on iOS and Android.
Experience testing RESTful APIs.
Experience with UX/usability testing and concerns.
Knowledge of programming languages and process management methodology.
Knowledge of test methodologies and their corresponding tools.
The ability to recognize risks and errors in an application, including security concerns.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Good time management and organizational skills.
The ability to keep current with the constantly changing technology industry.
A passion for testing, development, and design details.
Benefits
Remote Team - Work from anywhere!
Health insurance available.
15 days PTO + 10 company holidays per year.

Summary: The main function of a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) is to develop and execute software test plans in order to identify software problems and their causes.
Job Responsibilities:
Execute test plans, scenarios, scripts or procedures
Test system modifications to prepare for implementation
Develop testing programs that address areas such as database impacts, software scenarios, or usability
Document software defects, using a bug tracking system, and report defects to software developers
Identify, analyze and document problems with program function, output, online screen or content
Monitor bug resolution efforts and track successes
Create or maintain databases of known test defects
Plan test schedules or strategies in accordance with project scope or delivery dates
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required
5-7 years of experience required Development and programming experience
Experience with automated testing tools and technologies
Sr. SDET
More than 10 years' experience overall as a programmer or SDET or combo
5+ years’ experience as a true SDET
Programming- Angular, React (prefers Angular but React is ok)
Test automation- java, selenium, cucumber- all
Typescripts, any other UI framework
Need Jenkins experience
Performance testing experience using tools link-load runner, Jmeter, tools like Gatling *preferred. Performance testing not a must-have.
The app is devolved using AWS serverless technology. The front end of the application is Angular typescript. Back- end is angular, AWS, lambda, typescript, GaphQL. Data they're storing is in DynamoDB
AWS Services- Lambda, DynamoDB, GraphQL, EC2
AWS certified solution architect associate certification NEEDED
Ideally want someone to come on board that already has it, if not they will work to get cert once they join the team.
Various industries are ok, don't have to come from the financial industry - NO FED BACKGROUNDS.
Day to Day:
Will be the lead's right hand. Want help with building automation frameworks. Will try different POCs and see if different tools will work. Very passionate to try various things. Good communication and presentation skills.
Mainly coding 80%- 90% of the day coding
Kanban- don’t have scripts, the developers pick up a task, once it's done they pick up the next task. Don’t operate based on sprint. Based on their availability they pick up more tasks.
UI automation. Have an angular application, need coverage for the UI part. Need this person to help ramp up automation and build frameworks to automate application- like how to test a specific component
Thanks,
Ambika

3 openings – all are senior level roles
Looking for someone very technical – development level coding
They don't do manual testing – they try to automate as much as they can
DXT – 2 more years for this project
Working to bring in more functionalities for broker/dealer clients into 1 place – right now they have to go through/to various different systems – effort to streamline so customers can access all in 1 place. All efforts are exposed as microservices
Angular is the front end – everything is serverless
Looking for some kind of AWS experience – if they don't have experience, at least commitment to get the AWS solution architect cert
Angular/Typescript, GraphQL, lambda functions – any version of angular is ok
